intro: Oreophylax bellidifolius, commonly known as the Sierra bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming a basal rosette. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is adapted to harsh alpine environments.
